QuickReads

 

Welcome to Miami Living Magazineâ€™s newsletterâ€” a round up of happenings and smart reads.

Good morning, everyone! Once again, Miami takes center stage in the art world as Art Basel Miami Beach returns on December 5â€“7, 2025. 


Before diving into art, weâ€™d like to wish you a happy and healthy Thanksgiving. If youâ€™re celebrating outside your home, weâ€™ve put together a list of restaurants offering Thanksgiving specials, tips to prevent food poisoning while hosting, and some historical insights on the popular story of the Pilgrimsâ€™ Thanksgiving that is often overlooked.

Photo/Art Basel Miami Beach

Art Basel Miami Beach 2025

  • Weâ€™ve created a special guide with helpful tips, what to expect, and an interactive map to quickly explore the wide array of satellite events happening throughout Miami Art Week.

 

Italian Luxury Designs

  • This year, the allure of Italian design shines during Miami Art Week. Weâ€™ve curated a selection of renowned, high-quality brands that are must-visits for design enthusiasts.

 

Art Happenings

  • Weâ€™ve added a new section to Miami Livingâ€™s website highlighting other events during Art Basel Miami and Miami Art Week.

 

Food

  • During Art Basel Miami Beach, weâ€™ve rounded up dining options across Wynwood, the Design District, South Beach, Little River, North Miami Beach, and Downtown to make your culinary experience as exciting as the art.  

     

 

Interviews

 

  • Colombian-born entrepreneur and creative visionary Lex Borrero sits down with Miami Living to share how heâ€™s redefining success, creativity, and purpose through his work with NEON16 and his podcast "You vs You."

Updates

  • The World Architecture Festival happened here in Miami. We bring you a look at the winners of architecture, interiors and landscape design. Meanwhile, the iconic Delano Hotel in Miami Beach is set to reopen in March 2026, and Google has launched its first South Florida retail store at Aventura Mall.

Magazine

 

  • World-renowned pianist Yuja Wang takes center stage in Miami Livingâ€™s Art Issue, sharing her virtuosity, creative process, and artistry with Rolex and global orchestras in a candid interview. We also highlight her 2026 performance schedule, though she has no Miami dates planned.

  

As always, thank you for taking the time to read Miami Living!

 

 

Visit our social accounts
Visit Miami Living Magazine
